p: The hydrodistillation of O. basilicum yielded an essential oil content of 0.5 ml/100 g of herbage. The extracted O. basilicum EO was characterized by gas chromatography coupled to mass spectroscopy. The compounds were identified by the reported retention index. The chemical formula, molecular weight, and their chemical structures are presented in Table 1 and Fig, 1. The major components present in O. basilicum EO were methyl chavicol (70.93%), linalool (9.34%), epi-α-cadinol (3.69 %), methyl eugenol (2.48%), γ-cadinene (1.67%), 1,8-cineole (1.30%) and ( E)-β-ocimene (1.11%).
